page.title: 17VILLAGE HALL,CHELMARSH
page.content: The village hall is run by a management committee consisting of representatives from the various governing bodies of councils,clubs,church,school and committees. It is built mainly of timber and has a tin roof.In 1984 nearly Â£30000 was raised to build a new entrance,toilets,kitchen,store room and committee room. During the day the school uses the hall for physical education,drama and for cooking and eating lunch.In the evening and weekends it is used for a variety of purposes including meetings,disco dancing,rummage sales,entertainment and lectures.
